column4: I know this isn't strictly a Ubuntu question, but I'd appreciate any help. I just downloaded RealPlayer10GOLD.bin, and when I double click it it asks what the best application is to open it with...
I thought a .bin was a binary, and that it would just... open...
Does anybody have any suggestions?
yuo have to set the executable permission
nikrud, Lokii-, I still get the same error... and when I tried "sh RealPlayerGOLD10.bin" it said: "cannot execute binary file"
yep. I tried it using "chmod a+x" and when that didn't work I also used "chmod 777"...
when you double click a bin with the executable set it will ask you if you want to run in terminal or display
it says "Open RealPlayer10GOLD.bin" and other files of type unknown with: "Recommended Applications: [none]" "Other Applications: [a huge list...]"
maybe this is a dumb questions, have you tried synaptec to install it?
nope, I tried apt-get and it couldn't find it... so I assumed synaptec couldn't either =/
I get "package realplayer has no installation candidate"
you could download the redhat package and alien it to a deb
How do you alien a redhat package to a deb?
it can be done, I'd focus on getting the bin to work though
Do you think it could be because I'm running Xubuntu instead of Ubuntu? Maybe Xubuntu doesn't support it...
do a md5sum [file] on that for me, and paste the output
it said: ca87acf8e0cdf928cf31ca381acf04f2 RealPlayer10Gold.bin
mmk, that's what i get to: ok, here's what I do to install it
its sitting on my desktop, I did chmod a+x, then ./Real[rest of filename]
It extracts the files and asks to continue, that's how it should work
thanks I will try that
